text: The Oman Open is a European Tour golf tournament, held at Al Mouj Golf in Muscat, Oman. When founded in 2018, it was one of five European Tour events to be staged in the Arabian Peninsula, but is currently one of six. Though it was the first European Tour event in Oman, the course had previously hosted the Challenge Tour's National Bank of Oman Golf Classic from 2013–2014 and the NBO Golf Classic Grand Final from 2015–2017. ==Winners== {|class=wikitable style="font-size:95%" !Year!!Date!!Winner!!Country!!Score!!To par!!Margin of victory!!Runner(s)-up!!Winner's share ($)!!Purse ($) |- ! colspan="11" |Oman Open |- | 2020 || Mar 1 || Sami Välimäki || || align=center|275 || align=center|−13 || Playoff || Brandon Stone || 291,667 ||1,750,000 |- | 2019 || Mar 2 || Kurt Kitayama || || align=center|281 || align=center|−7 || 1 stroke || Jorge Campillo Maximilian Kieffer Clément Sordet Fabrizio Zanotti ||291,667 ||1,750,000 |- ! colspan="11" |NBO Oman Open |- | 2018 || Feb 18 ||Joost Luiten || || align=center|272 || align=center|−16 || 2 strokes || Chris Wood || 291,667 || 1,750,000 |} ==References== ==External links== *Coverage on the European Tour's official site Category:European Tour events Category:Golf in Oman Category:Recurring sporting events established in 2018 Category:2018 establishments in Oman
title: Oman Open
